intro: Podospermum kandavanicum, commonly known as the Kandavan starling plant, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has dark green, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
